intro: Spermacoce sintenisii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has a slender, upright stem with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers emit a sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Spermacoce sintenisii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique blooming habit and aesthetic appeal.
